Flub.Name: Scale
Flub.Description: The relative size of the cellular subdivision.

Flub.Name: Chaos
Flub.Description: The general randomness of the subdivision. Low values create systematic cells; high values cause the cells to widely differ both in shape and number of sides.

Flub.Name: Seed
Flub.Description: The randomization pattern or seed for the node's process.

Flub.Name: Function
Flub.Description: The distance function used to determine the cell shape.

Flub.Name: Manhattan
Flub.Description: Manhattan creates slightly unnatural multi-angled shapes, which can be quite useful when processed further.

Flub.Name: Shepards
Flub.Description: Shepards provides stark peaks and sinkholes.

Flub.Name: Hybrid
Flub.Description: Euclidean-Manhattan hybrid merges both distancing functions equally.
